p: The heavy metals of cadmium and lead contained in the pigments used in the manufacture of plastic bags, and the antioxidants and stabilizers, are inorganic and organic chemicals that serve to protect the plastic against thermal decomposition during the manufacturing process. These industrial chemicals are thought to be a great source of atmospheric pollution since they are able to bond with other elements and form compounds such as chlorides, oxides, and sulfides [4], all of which contribute to a considerable degree towards ozone destruction based on their varying proportions and depending on a range of factors [5].
